editor

Class LevelSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • editor.LevelSolver

  • public class LevelSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility for computing the solutions of levels in parallel. The main method can be used as a command line utility that will output the data to pre-set file paths.
    Author:
    Sean Lewis

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Args input syntax: - put "GG all" to output all standard GG level data. - put "GG" if standard game levels are being solved: - if so, place numbers afterwards for which levels - ex: GG 1 2 3 4 5 - this solves the first 5 levels - otherwise, put "OTHER" as the first command - the 2nd command should be the input file - the 3rd command should be the output directory destination - then place the file name where levels are being read from - place numbers the same was as in standard input - NOTE: the first level will be level 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSolutionSet

        public static java.util.Collection<java.awt.Point> getSolutionSet(Level level)
        Computes all solutions to the level and returns in the points in a List.
        Parameters:
        level - the level to solve
        Returns:
        all points such that level.possibleWin(p) returns true

      • printSolutionSet

        public static void printSolutionSet(java.util.Collection<java.awt.Point> solutions,
                    java.io.PrintWriter pw)
        Prints a solution set through a PrintWriter.
        Parameters:
        solutions - the solution set to print
        pw - the PrintWriter to print through

      • printSolutionSet

        public static void printSolutionSet(Level level,
                    java.io.PrintWriter pw)
        Computes the level data and then prints the information to a PrintWriter.
        Parameters:
        level - the Level to solve
        pw - the PrintWriter to print through

      • readSolutionSet

        public static java.util.Collection<java.awt.Point> readSolutionSet(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Reads in a solution set from a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file to read from
        Returns:
        a List of solution points for the level
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file was not found
